definition: Unique identifier for each building (format: CITY_NUMBER, e.g. NYC_1000160125)
Street address of building
City name extracted from address
Two-letter state abbreviation
5-digit ZIP code
Geographic latitude coordinate
Geographic longitude coordinate
Common name of property (e.g. '2 World Financial Center')
URL to original data source (e.g. Energy Star Portfolio Manager)
Original ID from source database
Building use type (e.g. Office, Hotel, K-12 School)
Simplified building type for UI filtering
Building type used for EUI benchmarking
Market vertical: Commercial, Education, Healthcare, or Government
Year building was constructed
Gross floor area in square feet
Year the energy data was reported
Legal owner of the building
Property management company
Primary tenant organization
Sub-unit or department within tenant organization
Site Energy Use Intensity in kBtu per square foot per year
Median EUI for this building type (for comparison)
Total annual site energy consumption in kBtu
Annual electricity consumption in kBtu
Annual electricity consumption in kWh
Annual natural gas consumption in kBtu
Annual district steam consumption in kBtu
Annual fuel oil consumption in kBtu
EPA Energy Star score (1-100, higher = more efficient)
Climate zone for Energy Star calculations (Northern, South-Central, etc.)
Electricity rate in dollars per kWh
Electricity demand charge in dollars per kW
Load factor used to estimate peak demand (0-1)
Estimated peak electricity demand in kW
Annual electricity energy charges (usage only) in USD
Annual electricity demand charges in USD
Total annual electricity cost (energy + demand) in USD
Natural gas rate in dollars per therm
Annual natural gas cost in USD
District steam rate in dollars per thousand pounds
Annual district steam cost in USD
Fuel oil rate in dollars per gallon
Annual fuel oil cost in USD
Name of electric utility used for rate lookup
Notes on how costs were calculated or estimated
Fraction of electricity used for HVAC (0-1), from CBECS data
Fraction of natural gas used for HVAC (0-1), from CBECS data
Fraction of district steam used for HVAC (0-1), from CBECS data
Fraction of fuel oil used for HVAC (0-1), from CBECS data
Total annual HVAC energy in kBtu = sum of (fuel_kbtu × hvac_pct) for each fuel
Total annual HVAC cost in USD = sum of (fuel_cost × hvac_pct) for each fuel
Method used to determine HVAC percentages (CBECS lookup key)
Total annual GHG emissions in metric tons CO2 equivalent
Fraction of rentable space currently vacant (0-1)
Fraction of occupied space actually in use during business hours (0-1)

Percentage of HVAC costs saved by ODCV (0.20-0.50). Derived from: opportunity score (vacancy + utilization) × automation score (year + sqft) × efficiency modifier × climate modifier, clamped to building type bounds
Annual HVAC utility cost savings from ODCV in USD = hvac_cost_total_annual × odcv_hvac_savings_pct
Year 1 carbon emissions reduction from ODCV in metric tons CO2e. Calculated from energy reduction × emission factors per fuel type
Name of Building Performance Standard law (e.g. 'NYC LL97', 'Boston BERDO')
Year 1 BPS penalty avoided by implementing ODCV in USD. Calculation varies by city law type (emission cap, EUI target, or Energy Star based)
Total annual operating expense savings in USD = odcv_hvac_savings_annual_usd + bps_fine_avoided_yr1_usd
ODCV savings as percentage of total annual energy cost = odcv_hvac_savings_annual_usd / (cost_elec_total_annual + cost_gas_annual + cost_steam_annual + cost_fuel_oil_annual)
Capitalization rate for property valuation (stored as percentage, e.g. 7.5 means 7.5%)
Market rent in dollars per square foot per year
Operating expenses as fraction of gross income (0-1)
Estimated current property value in USD = (energy_cost / 0.12 × 0.60) / (cap_rate / 100)
Estimated property value after ODCV in USD = val_current_usd + val_odcv_impact_usd
Property value increase from ODCV in USD = savings_opex_avoided_annual_usd / (val_cap_rate_pct / 100)
URL to building photo image
